results.title: Why I use Tape Instead of Mocha & So Should You
results.comment: TL;DR: Mocha is a $150k Porsche Panamera when the best tool for the job is a $30k Tesla Model 3. Don’t waste your resources on testing bells and whistles. Invest them in creating your app, instead.

results.title: Building the F8 2016 App
results.comment:
How Facebook team built a mobile application for both iOS and Android platforms, using React Native.

Quite thorough and it's really interesting to see how the Facebook team works with their own tools (like "Flow" for static type checking)

results.title: React Native: A year in review
Angular 2 + React Native
results.comment: The best of the 2 worlds ?

results.title: Building realtime applications with CycleJS and RxJS
results.comment: An article from pusher.com blog: "How to build a realtime chat application using CycleJS, a functional, reactive framework that uses the Reactive JavaScript Extensions under the hood. We’ll see how to model an application using Cycle and get familiar with the core concept of RxJS: data as streams that can be observed."

results.title: The Making of “The Aviator”: Animating a Basic 3D Scene with Three.js
results.comment: "A tutorial that explores the basics of creating animated 3D scenes using Three.js."

results.title: 3 Lightweight React Alternatives: Preact, VirtualDom & Deku
results.comment: An in-depth comparison of 3 React alternatives (Deku, Preact and Virtual Dom) and why they could prove useful for your next project.

results.title: JavaScript Testing: Unit vs Functional vs Integration Tests
results.comment: An extensive look at testing from a JavaScript point of view including what different types of testing you can do and how they relate to each other.

results.title: Performance optimisations for React applications
results.comment: The key takeaway: “Return false from shouldComponentUpdate as high up in your application as you can.”

results.title: Testing in React: Getting Off The Ground
results.comment: A high level guide into testing your React Application

results.title: Creating a Donation Widget with Flight Components
results.comment: Learning the basics of Twitter’s Flight.js by making a donation widget, using Materialize for the front-end, and Stripe to handle the payments.

results.title: Sinon Tutorial: JavaScript Testing with Mocks, Spies & Stubs
results.comment: Sinon helps eliminate complexity in tests by allowing you to easily create so called ‘test-doubles’

results.title: When should I use TypeScript?
results.comment: What makes a good use case for Typescript and when it doesn’t make sense to use it.

results.title: Functional Programming for JavaScript People
results.comment: This is not a casual read (get coffee) - it digs deep, but you’ll learn some cool stuff about functional programming concepts.

results.title: Animating with React, Redux, and d3
results.comment: The whole thing is built with React, Redux, and d3. No tricks for animation; just a bit of cleverness.

results.title: Server-Side Rendering With React, Node And Express
results.comment: A very in-depth tutorial, with code, diagrams, and insights into the process behind creating an isomorphic React and Express app.

results.title: Introduction to Functional Reactive Programming with RxJS
results.comment: Playing with The Reactive Extensions for JavaScript (RxJS) library

results.title: Essential Tools for Building SPAs With AngularJS
results.comment: The best tools to get the job done right.

results.title: A gentle introduction to functional JavaScript
results.comment: Gentle, well-presented 4 parter on functional JavaScript, starting from ‘why’.

results.title: 9 things every React.js beginner should know
results.comment: Some good practices like using functional components.

results.title: Pocket-sized JavaScript
results.comment: Being minimalist from the start and using new techniques like Virtual DOM and Web Workers, we can do more with less and build blazing fast apps on mobile.

results.title: Lodash: 10 Javascript Utility Functions That You Should Probably Stop Rewriting
results.comment: "Whereas jQuery is the Swiss Army knife of DOM, Lodash is the equivalent of the Batman’s utility belt for Javascript."

results.title: Full-Stack Redux Tutorial
results.comment: One of the best tutorials I've seen related to Redux, covering a wide range of technologies such as React, Immutable and testing.

results.title: Ionic Framework: A definitive 10,000 word guide Read
results.comment: A comprehensive guide to creating a hybrid app with Ionic from development to publishing in the app store.
